page.title: 04A VISIT TO SAVILL GARDENS
page.content: In Savill Gardens they grow flowers like Camellia,Magnolia,Primula,irises, Daffodils,Bluebells,Hydrangia and Japanese Maple.They all have to be grown in acid soil otherwise they wont grow.The Queen and many other members of the Royal family either walk or ride through the gardens.They have about 100,000 visitors a year and 80% of them are local and live around the area.Mr Bond, the man who we spoke to,is in charge of the park and gardens, he has worked there for 26 years, he would not want to change to another park or garden.Savill Garden is very busy on Sundays and Bank Holidays especially.The garden opened in 1948 and is still open now.Eric Savill took charge of the gardens.Then the Queen knighted him and when he died the gardens were named in his honour.
